results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;McDonald, Megan (1982-2003);Holley, Edward (March 14, 2003 Murder);Middletown (Orange County, NY)
results.title: After 20 Years, an Arrest in the Murder of a Detective’s Daughter
results.abstract: Megan McDonald, whose father was a Police Department detective, was found dead near a dirt path outside Middletown, N.Y. This week, her former boyfriend was arrested.

media.caption: The search for Megan McDonald’s killer lasted more than 20 years.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Computers and the Internet;Compensation for Damages (Law);Privacy;Cambridge Analytica;Facebook Inc;Meta Platforms Inc;California;United States
results.title: How to Claim Your Share of Facebook’s $725 Million Privacy Settlement
results.abstract: Anyone who had a U.S. Facebook account between May 2007 and December 2022 is eligible to apply, though payouts are likely to be small.

media.caption: The offices of Meta, Facebook’s parent company, in Menlo Park, Calif., in 2022.

results.adx_keywords: Diabetes;Diet and Nutrition;Ozempic (Drug);Weight;Malnutrition
results.title: An Extreme Risk of Taking Ozempic: Malnutrition
results.abstract: The diabetes medication has gained attention for its dramatic weight loss effects — but doctors worry that it can go too far.

results.adx_keywords: Drug Abuse and Traffic;Fentanyl;Veterinary Medicine;Horses;your-feed-science;your-feed-healthcare;White House Office of National Drug Control Policy;Drug Enforcement Administration
results.title: The Fight Over a Drug That Is Great for Horses but Horrific for Humans
results.abstract: Drug dealers are mixing xylazine, an animal tranquilizer relied on by veterinarians, into fentanyl, with deadly results. But controlling it is tricky.
org_facet: White House Office of National Drug Control Policy

media.caption: Boyd Spratling, a veterinarian in Deeth, Nev., worries that access to medicine he uses, xylazine, will shrink as it is regulated to stop the spread of its use as a street drug.
media.copyright: Kim Raff for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Transgender;Law and Legislation;State Legislatures;United States Politics and Government;Zephyr, Zooey;Gianforte, Greg (1961- );Montana
results.title: Republicans Call for Censure of Transgender Lawmaker Who Condemned Care Ban
results.abstract: Rep. Zooey Zephyr, a Democratic state representative in Montana, pleaded for her colleagues to reject a bill that would ban transition care for transgender minors. Republicans misgendered her and called for her to be censured.

results.adx_keywords: Arbitration, Conciliation and Mediation;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);United States Politics and Government;Conspiracy Theories;Politics and Government;Lindell, Mike;My Pillow Inc
results.title: ‘Prove Mike Wrong’ for $5 Million, Lindell Pitched. Now He’s Told to Pay Up.
results.abstract: An arbitration panel ruled that the MyPillow founder had failed to pay a computer software expert who disproved his false election claims as part of a contest.

media.caption: Mike Lindell, the MyPillow chief executive, at former President Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort this month. Mr. Lindell has vociferously pushed conspiracy theories about the 2020 presidential election.

results.adx_keywords: Alligators;Animal Abuse, Rights and Welfare;Prospect Park (Brooklyn, NY)
results.title: Emaciated Alligator Rescued From Prospect Park Dies
results.abstract: The animal, which ingested a bathtub stopper, had severe weight loss, extreme anemia and infections, a post-mortem examination showed.

media.caption: The alligator at the Bronx Zoo, where it was brought for rehabilitation after being found in Prospect Park in February.

results.adx_keywords: Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);Mass Shootings;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Photography;Crime and Criminals;United States Politics and Government;Holder, Eric H Jr;Bushmaster Firearms;Newtown (Conn)
results.title: They Saw the Horrific Aftermath of a Mass Shooting. Should We?
results.abstract: The crime-scene investigators are the ones who document, and remember, the unimaginable. This is what they saw at Sandy Hook.

media.caption: Detectives Art Walkley, left, and Karoline Keith and Sgt. Jeff Covello, crime-scene investigators for the Connecticut State Police.
media.copyright: Elinor Carucci for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Colbert, Stephen;Fallon, Jimmy;Kimmel, Jimmy;Klepper, Jordan
results.title: Late Night Laughs at Elon Musk’s SpaceX Explosion
results.abstract: “When people saw the rocket light up and start smoking, they were like, ‘All right, happy 4/20, everybody!’” Jimmy Fallon joked on Thursday.

media.caption: Jimmy Fallon said SpaceX calling the explosion a “rapid unscheduled disassembly” “sounds like what celebrities say when they’re getting divorced.”

results.adx_keywords: Organ Donation;Heart;Transplants;Cancer;Death and Dying
results.title: My Transplanted Heart and I Will Die Soon
results.abstract: Organ transplantation is mired in stagnant science and antiquated, imprecise medicine that fails patients and organ donors.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Moving and Moving Industry;Content Type: Service
results.title: I’m Buying a House. Can the Seller Really Take the Chandeliers?
results.abstract: In a typical sale, anything affixed to the walls, floors or ceilings stays with the house. But there’s always room for negotiation.

results.adx_keywords: Movies;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Firearms;Accidents and Safety;Baldwin, Alec;Gutierrez-Reed, Hannah;Hutchins, Halyna (1979-2021);Carmack-Altwies, Mary;Reeb, Andrea;New Mexico;Santa Fe (NM)
results.byline: By Graham Bowley and Julia Jacobs
results.title: ‘Rust’ Prosecutors Are Dropping Charges Against Alec Baldwin
results.abstract: Mr. Baldwin had been charged with involuntary manslaughter after the gun he was practicing with went off on a film set, killing the cinematographer. The film’s armorer still faces charges.

media.caption: Alec Baldwin was charged this year in connection with the “Rust” shooting in New Mexico. “We are pleased with the decision to dismiss the case,” his lawyers said.

results.adx_keywords: Emotions;Anger (Emotion);Anxiety and Stress;Mental Health and Disorders
results.title: Lean Into Negative Emotions. It’s the Healthy Thing to Do.
results.abstract: Recent research suggests that while bad feelings can affect your well-being, your perspective on those feelings can play an even bigger role in your mental health.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome;Mercenaries and Private Military Contractors;Prisoners of War;Wagner Group;Ukraine;Russia
results.title: ‘A Quick Death or a Slow Death’: Prisoners Choose War to Get Lifesaving Drugs
results.abstract: An estimated 20 percent of Russia prisoner recruits are H.I.V. positive. To some, the front lines seemed less risky than prisons where they said they were denied effective treatments.

media.caption: A captured Wagner fighter loyal to Russian forces being escorted by a Ukrainian guard at a prison in Dnipro, central Ukraine.
media.copyright: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Transgender;Documentary Films and Programs;Sundance Film Festival (Park City, Utah);Doran, Harris;Koko Da Doll;Rasheeda Williams;Human Rights Campaign;Atlanta (Ga)
results.title: Koko Da Doll, Star of Film on Transgender Sex Workers, Is Killed in Atlanta
results.abstract: The 35-year-old was featured in “Kokomo City,” a documentary about four Black transgender sex workers that won awards at the Sundance Film Festival this year.

media.caption: Koko Da Doll at the 2023 Sundance Film Festival, where the documentary she was in, “Kokomo Cty,” was honored.

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Service;Customs, Etiquette and Manners;internal-sub-only
results.title: Should I Tell a Young Relative That Her Grandmother Tried to Swindle Me?
results.abstract: A reader wonders whether to explain the history of a bitter family rift to a great-niece who she suspects does not know the whole story.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Police Department (NYC);Bronx (NYC)
results.title: N.Y.P.D. Shoots Man in Mental Distress After Responding to 911 Call
results.abstract: The man, who the police said was holding scissors and a kitchen knife when an officer shot him in the Bronx, was in critical condition.

media.caption: The scene of a police shooting Friday morning in the Morrisania section of the Bronx that left a 39-year-old man in critical condition.
media.copyright: David Dee Delgado for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Divorce, Separations and Annulments;Personal Finances;Marriages;internal-sub-only
results.title: A Prenup Saved Me When My Husband Left. One Could Save You, Too.
results.abstract: They have long been considered unromantic, but prenuptial agreements are being embraced by some couples as a way to protect themselves on their own terms.

results.adx_keywords: Hate Crimes;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Robinson, Malachi (May 29, 2019, Attempted Murder);Kansas City (Mo)
results.title: Man Gets Nearly 22 Years in Prison for Shooting Teen in Hate Crime
results.abstract: Malachi Robinson lured a 16-year-old boy into a wooded area in Kansas City, Mo., in 2019 and shot him eight times, prosecutors said. The boy survived the attack.

media.caption: Malachi Robinson of Kansas City, Mo., was sentenced to nearly 22 years in prison for shooting a man because of his sexual orientation.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Classical Music;Books and Literature;Writing and Writers;Television;Tindall, Blair
results.title: Blair Tindall, Whose Music Memoir Scandalized, Dies at 63
results.abstract: Her 2005 book, “Mozart in the Jungle,” lived up to its subtitle, “Sex, Drugs, and Classical Music,” and was later made into an Amazon TV series.

media.caption: Blair Tindall in 2005, the year “Mozart in the Jungle,” her book about her years as a professional oboe player, was published.
